page.title: 02HEALTH
page.content: AT SARUM CENTRE THERE ARE 130 MENTALLY HANDICAPPED ADULTS BUT THEY DO NOT LIVE THERE. THEY HAVE NO RESIDENTIAL ADULTS. THE MENTALLY HANDICAPPED PEOPLE WHO ATTEND SARUM CENTRE LIVE ALL OVER THE SOUTH OF WILTSHIRE. THEY GET THERE BY MINIBUSES AND CARS. THEY GO FOR THE WHOLE DAY FROM 9 AM TO 4 PM. THEY HAVE DINNER THERE. THE MEN AND WOMEN DO A LOT OF SORTING FOR FIRMS IN SALISBURY. THEY ALSO DO IRONING AND GARDENING. IN SALISBURY THERE IS A HOSPITAL CALLED SALISBURY GENERAL INFIRMARY. THERE ARE NO DOCTORS' SURGERIES WITHIN OUR BLOCK. IF ANYBODY NEEDS A DOCTOR OR DENTIST THEY HAVE TO GO INTO THE CITY. THE SCHOOL DOCTOR AND THE SCHOOL DENTIST VISIT THE SCHOOL AT REGULAR INTERVALS TO OVERSEE THE GENERAL HEALTH OF ALL THE PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL.
